intro: Scutia capensis f. obcordata, commonly known as the Cape honeysuckle, is a flowering plant native to southern Africa. It belongs to the family Bignoniaceae and is characterized by its showy, orange-red tubular flowers that bloom in clusters. The plant has opposite, ovate leaves with a distinctive obcordate shape at the base, giving it its specific epithet. It thrives in full sun and well-drained soil, making it a popular ornamental plant in gardens. Its nectar-rich flowers attract birds and insects, contributing to its ecological importance.
